website_summaries.verdict: A basic lock box that also offers the added peace of mind of limited fire protection for about half the price of its competitors.
pros: Has a feature set that includes steel double-insulated design, easy-to-use keyed lock, and 2 convenient handles
Flame-retardant (750 degrees for 15 minutes) construction is also surprisingly lightweight, weighing only 6.5 pounds
cons: Lock is flimsier than those of costlier models
Key occasionally jams in the lock

customer_reviews.title: safe box
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these from years ago. I was in need of having a few more. I wanted to be able to save some important documents to store safely. I know these are not top quality but are serving the purpose for me. For fun I took one outside and used the garden hose on it, and no water got in. I was happy for that. I would recommend them if you need a safe place to hold important papers.
customer_reviews.author: teenieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This is a piece of crap! Assembly is required
customer_reviews.text: I originally gave this 1 star but, come to find out, I had received one that wasn't complete. The modification makes the box close tight! It is a good box for the 700 degrees they specified. I guess the older box lids did not fit tight. That problem has been fixed.
customer_reviews.author: DAVE LAWTON

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy chest with a simple lock
customer_reviews.text: It's heavy, seems sturdy, and it's big enough to fit all my documents without folding them. The handles on each side are a nice addition. The lock is comparable to a desk lock, good enough to keep random people from snooping but if someone wants to get in then they will get in. If you're looking for that kind of security then this item is not for you, buy a safe instead. No idea how fireproof this chest is but it's quite heavy so I assume it'll be fine in case of a fire. 5/5 Good size, sturdy, lockable, does everything I want it to do
customer_reviews.author: Thomas K.

customer_reviews.title: Worst lockbox ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst lockbox imaginable. When I got the box, it looked legit, good weight, okay locking mechanism. But then, a simple tug on the lid while closed and locked boom, opens right up. Lock failure. And then I realized that simple tug caused the locking mechanism to become loose. Complete waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: casey

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Effective
customer_reviews.text: My primary concern in keeping my previous documents safe is honestly just fire/natural disaster. In that regard, as far as I can tell, this safety box will do just that. It's a simple but durable metal container with a simple locking mechanism. This container alone is pry not going to stop a determined thief, but I trust this will survive a fire. That's the most important thing to me. Comes with two document envelopes. Not entirely sure how/why I would use these, but I placed some stuff in there no less. Does not come with container dividers or anything like that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two handles on large size
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize there were TWO handles on this item. I thought it was just larger than the other size. Nope, it has another handle directly across from where the pictured handle it. That is not ideal for me & you can't take it off based on the design. I will adjust how I will be storing this as a result. Color, opening, ease of use of the key & nice large size still make it a purchase worthy product. Also wish I could have found the temperature it will withstand up to but I didn't see that information listed & I took a gamble that it will be enough if and when i would need that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous2018

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: " A sturdy locking key latch keeps the box secure" Is that why my mother was able to break into the box with scissors? "STEELMASTER name stands 70 plus years of metal fabrication experience" And yet it was beaten by a pair of scissors, I would like my money back as this is box can be opened by a 5 year old if they had enough determination.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Decent Strongbox, but easy to pick
customer_reviews.text: I got this for our will, birth certificates, etc. I am an amateur lock picker and can rake it open in a few seconds, so while it could stop a small child from getting in I would never place anything too valuable in it. As it is now I hide it. I've found that's usually the best way to keep things safe. It seems like it would take the 700 degrees it claims. Pretty good for 30 bucks...
customer_reviews.author: Kingfu72

customer_reviews.title: Junk-Junk-Junk
customer_reviews.text: This is a very thin and cheap product from China. It is a MDF Industries box and not a Steel Master as advertised. The dimensions advertised are external so you have to fold an 8 1/2 x 11 regular sized paper to fit inside. Internal dimensions are much smaller. I am going to return this and I would highly recommend anyone looking for one of these to look some where else. Typical junk made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Guy

customer_reviews.title: Tight seal, water proof
customer_reviews.text: I needed a safe , water proof container that would protect diplomas, certificates, and other important forms. The durability of this container is great, and it’s tough enough to not cave in- which I was impressed with considering the price! It’s convenient, and even spilling water on the container, didn’t damage anything inside so it has a tight seal.
customer_reviews.author: Francesca Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: We keep this box inside our safe
customer_reviews.text: Our new safe was not fire-retardant. But, it's roomy enough inside for keeping our important papers safe.. So, we got rid of the bank safe deposit box and now keep our papers (passports etc) at home, inside our new MMF security box, locked inside our safe.. It's very convenient, saving us time and money.. We also have digital copies of our documents stored off-site.. Just in case..
customer_reviews.author: Old Retired Man

customer_reviews.title: Lock is too easily picked
customer_reviews.text: I have this because my 10 year old son HAS to have a phone to stay in touch with me. I had a schedule developed to keep the phone inside, and this box is ideal because its lid is bigger than the box so I can keep a phone plugged in to a charger and the cord fits under the lid without getting crushed. Very handy. But the lock is very easy to pick. I do like the box enough to keep though for the ability to run the charger wire under the closed lid so I am going to add a latch and a padlock.
customer_reviews.author: Dewey

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for Lithium Batteries
customer_reviews.text: This is a much more rugged option for storing lithium rechargeable batteries than some of the containers marketed for that purpose. The case is fire resistant but is rugged and will not be easily damaged or bent like some of the alternatives intended to contain meltdowns. With the addition of a felt or plastic liner inside to prevent accidental shorting, this is my container of choice for the purpose. It also locks to limit access. While most lithium fires are a consequence of improper charging, the batteries are high energy density and an ounce of prevention.......
customer_reviews.author: Dr. D. Rossbach

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for . . . . .
customer_reviews.text: Hard to believe all the five star reviews. Lock is very weak, used box to hold coins and they eventually bent the lock mechanism to where it would not close. No real fire protection - its just a simple metal box with a lock intended to keep out young children. Not sure what you could use it for given its deficiencies.
customer_reviews.author: SAINT2

customer_reviews.title: Loosen the latch screw for easy use. See review
customer_reviews.text: As other people had found, the key can stick and is had to eneter, I fouind the phillips screw inside the box where the latch is.is tighten too tight. I loosen the screw and and the key goes in easy. Also lubicate the key entrance with powered graphite into the key opening. The key now goes in smoothly..
customer_reviews.author: R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the quality
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the sturdiness of this box as well as how easy and smooth it is to lock and unlock. I bought it after returning a file box from Masterlock due to the key becoming stuck the first time I locked it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: An excellent size for important papers
customer_reviews.text: I had visited the local branch of a nationwide office supply retailer to look for a fireproof case for some of my documents. Amazingly, they did not carry one of the appropriate size for manila file folders with 8 1/2x11 size documents. I found this steel chest, fireproof and just the right for manila folders, carried by Amazon. It is very sturdy, easy to carry with double handles, and a good size for several documents. I'm very pleased with the purchase and highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Good quality box but the actual dimensions are 12-3/4 x 8-1/4 x 4 inches
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good quality and well built security box. Please be aware of the actual dimensions. Contrary to what is in the description, the box I received is actually 12-3/4 x 8-1/4 x 4 inches, not wide enough for 8-1/2 x 11 letter size documents to lay flat completely. I'm using it to store LiPo batteries so it's not a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: Henry RC Pilot

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think it was possible for a mechanical locking safe to break within months! Locking mechanism stopped working and I have spent HOURS trying to fix it and I quit. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Haven't suffered earthquake, flood, or fire, thank ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't suffered earthquake, flood, or fire, thank heavens, so I haven't tested this box to he max. Nonetheless, others' reviews and the box's heft help me feel as if I have done something responsible to keep my will and other papers safe.
customer_reviews.author: alsoanonyma

customer_reviews.title: Great size for your paper documents! Measurements allow easy storage!
customer_reviews.text: Although I haven't had the opportunity to test this box out during a fire (thank goodness), it is a pretty reliable box. We have all of our important documents in it and it is hidden away. I really like how it can fit a full sheet of paper easily. The size of the box makes it really easy to store, as well!
customer_reviews.author: Elise Gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: Easily broken into
customer_reviews.text: We store our knives and scissors in in this box for safety but our daughter was able to very easily smash the box open by just throwing it on the tile floor. The lock stayed engaged but the soft steel bent and the lid popped open. We were able to wrestle the knife away, but we'll have to use a stronger box if we don't want people getting into it that easily.
customer_reviews.author: LoneStar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and simple
customer_reviews.text: Basic in looks but excellent quality. Nothing flashy or obvious for potential thieves to notice. Less bulky than the more common sentrysafe 0.16cu. ft fire chest. I definitely recommend this product for anyone needing to keep important documents (social security cards, birth certificates, etc) safe.
customer_reviews.author: StarryEyes

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: Not really impressed.....At all!! The security box arrived on time and was packaged well. The box however, is of very poor quality. I had this box for two weeks, and then the inner metal lining collapsed which makes it difficult to lock tight or lock at all. I had to search for and buy another locking arm so it would reach the inner wall and lock correctly. The construction is very poor, so it serve you well to spend more money and buy something better. I gave 2 stars because of good packaging and on time arrival.
customer_reviews.author: anthony botano

customer_reviews.title: I like the box very much
customer_reviews.text: I like the box very much, although papers have to be folded. In addition, due to the fire retardant qualities the safe holds a lot of moisture. I protect my papers by using gel packs and a moisture card that indicates when the gel packs need "recharging".
customer_reviews.author: Joemama

customer_reviews.title: Adequate but a dubious lock
customer_reviews.text: Decent box and adequate to my needs, with good size, but the lock is flimsy and a bit tricky, which is a concern for the future. I don't need much but if I needed this to be more secure I would not trust this. Since all I need is a deterrent it will do.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Kruger

customer_reviews.title: Good box
customer_reviews.text: It's more heavy duty than it looks. Actually more than just thin metal, however I STRONGLY recommend against using it for fire protection. Only containers that have a UL (Underwriters Laboratory) listing should be used for fire protection! It does not appear to have a UL listing. Understand that this is NOT a safe. But it's good for just keeping things organized and mild privacy protection like casual snooping.
customer_reviews.author: Cactus19

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable lock, easily broken into.
customer_reviews.text: Lock cylinder seized up on us, and I had to break into it myself. Was childs play to simply pry the hinge apart enough to pull the rod out. So it's only mildly more secure than a shoebox, and the locking mechanism is of very poor quality. For the price, I can only really complain about the lock.
customer_reviews.author: SambaSol

customer_reviews.title: The box is not 8. 8" wide. The ...
customer_reviews.text: The box is not 8.8" wide. The width is only 8.25" wide and therefore does not fit an 8.5" x 11" sheet of paper, unless of course you fold the paper. If you need to use this for full sheets without folding, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Science Dude

customer_reviews.title: nope
customer_reviews.text: it was galvanized steel and arrived broken. I had to reweld it, as the pinch welds they originally use were all broken, having been welded over the paint job.
customer_reviews.author: pooky

customer_reviews.title: Nice lock box for home use
customer_reviews.text: This is obviously NOT a safe, but it will protect documents from fire and keep nosy people out should anyone come across it. The storage capacity is nice and it does easily fit 8.5x11 papers without folding them. I'm using it to store my passport and historical tax documents. If you need more security than this provides, you really should get a safe deposit box at a bank and be done with it.
customer_reviews.author: Spyder_3kgt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I had been looking for! It includes two envelopes for you to store your important documents in and it's quite spacious. It's also very easy to store! 2 keys are included as well. (Which is great for a forgetful person like me!)
customer_reviews.author: Kittie

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT FIT 8.5 x 11 PAPER FLAT!
customer_reviews.text: I specifically bought this because the product was sized at 12.6 x 8.8 and I want to lay paper flat in it, and in the Q&A someone asked "can paper lie flat?" and the answer was "yes." Now that it has arrived the box says 12 3/4 by 8 1/4...and because it is 8 1/4 instead of 8 1/2, the paper does not lie flat. If the product description showed the box in the package as it arrived, you could see what the actual size is. And WHY in the world would you design a box that is 1/4 inch too narrow to fit a piece of paper flat?! What an idiotic design flaw! So I will be returning...
customer_reviews.author: JemAppel

customer_reviews.title: For Over A Year Now
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over a year and more and never had a problem with it, Its perfect i am able to fit any kind of files or anything small i need to secure in the box. If you are trying to get something to protect strongly tho.. i suggest you do not get this box. I mainly got it to put personal things because i was living with my little brothers at the time so i wanted privacy for certain items I didn't want them touching.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed and expected!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first security box. I bought it to store savings and important documents. It feels like very good quality. It's heavy and simple to open, once you have a key. It comes with two, which is relief, because I loose things a lot. It also comes with two envelopes so you can put your "important documents" in them. It's also a reasonable price. There are two reasons why I didn't give it five stars. -Although I don't need this, it doesn't have the handle as shown in the picture. -I think it'd be great if it came with money slots. Overall, I would buy this again or recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: siana

customer_reviews.title: 0 stars
customer_reviews.text: if I could give 0 stars, i would... The box may be fire safe, but i pinched the sides and the walls crushed under the stress. So based on reviews, I wanted to test its strength. I locked it and tried to pull it apart. It took no strength to open it. I actually walked next door to my neighbor and had her 10 year old sun try it. He easily pulled it open. This box is a joke. It is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: John Packard

customer_reviews.title: poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: This is poorly designed. Where the metal latches onto the indentation, very small, barely latches onto the metal groove. They dont make these as they used to be. It supposed to latch onto a METAL plate hinge, like the really nice ones are made. I havnt seen any lately. Instead like some of these they have like a styrofoam type filling in between the metal. And other ones where you can slide a pin between the crack to slide lock open. Not as secure as I would like it to be. I'm sure this would be a good deterrent against little kids. and thats about it.
customer_reviews.author: kaori

customer_reviews.title: 5🌟
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for not a lot of money! It's sturdy, it locks & unlocks easy. Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: all well and good, but I'm not personally about to test that ...
customer_reviews.text: If this actually acts as a fire retardant container, all well and good, but I'm not personally about to test that except under live conditions. As a lockbox, it is well constructed but doesn't seem particularly secure, as the locking mechanism is extremely basic, and I think anyone with a flat screwdriver could probably pry it open.
customer_reviews.author: rbyteme

customer_reviews.title: Great For 13x9 Envelopes!
customer_reviews.text: I think this box is very well made. I have had no issues with the key as some other reviewers said they did. It holds my 13x9 envelopes flat. There are a couple sizes so you have to make sure you order the right one. I would recommend this seller. A++
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Epic Fail
customer_reviews.text: The box looked great on arrival. Unfortunately, the top does not stay locked down when closed. Stick enough content in the box, and you'll see a good 1/4 inch opening under the lid. With that opening, it is easy to push the lid to the side and breech the security. Huge flaw in the design. Based on the flaw, there is no way this box will protect your personals from fire, flood, or theft. The box feels solid and the keys are convincing, but the lock is an epic fail.
customer_reviews.author: AmericanHarleyRider

customer_reviews.title: small dents
customer_reviews.text: When I got my box, I could not find the keys to it, I had a hard time to open the box because of some small dents to the box. I thought the keys were missing, after tugging on the lid I got the box to open. I really think the would of been solved if the keys were taped to the out side of the box, I was going to send the box back. But now I have the keys to the box I can live with a little dent. Before shipping I think things should be checked a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lish

customer_reviews.title: I like the size of the box and it is quite ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't try to set fire to it in order to check its fireproof quality. However, I like the size of the box and it is quite sturdy. The other boxes I considered were quite a bit smaller. This easily holds documents with room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy2

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the naysayers
customer_reviews.text: I don't write many reviews on Amazon. This one deserves it because it is getting a bad rap. There are lots of negative reviews on here about "flimsy material" and "poorly made product" etc. It started to steer me away from this product. The price told me to give it a try. I am not sure what product others received, however mine is fine. The case is very sturdy. Feels solid. The locking mechanism is also very supported and firm. This is a fantastic buy for the price. Have no fear when ordering this piece.
customer_reviews.author: JeromeK

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted. I bought this because my ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted. I bought this because my mom just died in her house fire... and cleaning through the ashes we found this with the contents undamaged. so i had to buy one for me.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Decent lock box
customer_reviews.text: I have some old family documents and photos that I wanted to protect, and this worked well enough that I ordered a second one for the other branch of the family. I would have given it five stars if it had been just a little heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Mills

customer_reviews.title: Great lock box for valuables and in case of a ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these before at Office Max I think. Tried to find one at a Meijer or Walmart. So I just ordered it here. Great lock box for valuables and in case of a fire. Just remember to hide it because it's easy to walk away with! :p
customer_reviews.author: NOE

customer_reviews.title: Lost my keys
customer_reviews.text: Lost both keys, but opened it with a flathead screwdriver. I didn't buy this to be extremely secure, just something to inconvenience someone rifling through my stuff. Just know that if you lose your keys, you too can open it easily! Simply place the flathead in the lock, and turn real hard. The whole locking mechanism will twist. Great box imo.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio

customer_reviews.title: Love it! It doesn't hold folders
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It doesn't hold folders, but big enough to hold folded documents. It definitely is big enough to hold many items. It's sturdy, and love that the handle is on the side where you can carry it like a brief case, instead of those where the handle is on top. I definitely recommend this storage box.
customer_reviews.author: Hedy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap way to deter a non-determined thief or small flames?
customer_reviews.text: interior dimensions for the one I bought is around 12" long x 10" wide x 3.25" deep *besides the latch which dips down > 1 inch. I may consider using it for an ammunition box.
customer_reviews.author: K-Po

customer_reviews.title: Good box, but didn't realize to keep it closed ...
customer_reviews.text: Good box, but didn't realize to keep it closed it has to be locked. Also would be better with one handle on the front of the box, instead of two handles on the sides. Otherwise, meets our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: Satisfied with what I got for the price, May 2017 purchase date. . Did not receive any dents with mine. The construction is double walled, but not vacuum double walled. So I bought a fiberglass heat proof envelope/bag for more heat protection. The lock and lid seal with mine also fit very good. I was initially worried that I'd get an older model with the quarter inch gap when locked.
customer_reviews.author: L11

customer_reviews.title: Its heavy
customer_reviews.text: I actually own this myself but I bought this one for my mother and it's too big for her. It is very large and heavy especially when it's full of papers. Hence the 2 handles.
customer_reviews.author: love 2 read

customer_reviews.title: Well made!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have purchased. It is very well made (not in China) and comes with 2 keys. There is nothing out there with it's quality of metal for the price!! Costco's were 3 times the price and no better. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R. D. Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Durable, great box to have, also makes a great gift!
customer_reviews.text: I previously purchased one of these 20 years ago to keep my valuable documents safe. A friend of mine & I were talking and she saw mine, liked it so I surprised her and got it for her. She loves it! Was thrilled that it was not heavy ( good thing ), and was shocked to find out it held a lot! Also fireproof. Makes a great gift! By the way, my 20year old one looks like new... No rust, and it looked like the new one. I am extremely satisfied with mine! Best thing I ever invested in.
customer_reviews.author: M. Serlick

customer_reviews.title: Lock problem
customer_reviews.text: After using this lockbox a few times, the lock mechanism is stripped. The nut on the inside won't tighten making the whole lock assembly useless. The rest of the box seems fine but, other than the hinge, the lock is the only mechanical/moving part. I bought two of these and the other seems fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: gerriab

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Just as expected. I like to keep a few things locked for privacy from others in the home and this works great. Just check sizing before ordering because it’s relatively small, so make sure it will hold whatever items you plan to put inside. Comes with two keys.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Boop

customer_reviews.title: Great security box
customer_reviews.text: Great security box, got exactly what I expected to get. Has some weight to it, more than I expected, so it is made of a decent gauge metal. Obviously this will not keep a professional out of it...and it can be just carried off...but it is great to store documents, items and protect them from nosy people. For the price, it is a great value. The only wish I have is that instead of two, these type boxes would come with three or four keys. But all the boxes I have researched only supply two keys...
customer_reviews.author: Tool Chick

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lock because I had been looking for one and didn't want to spend a lot. I just needed a small, simple box for a few important papers that I kept misplacing. I don't think it is as big as the dimensions say, but that wasn't important to me, as it is large and deep enough for what I needed. I like that I can just lock it and stick it on the top shelf in the closet. For the price, this is a great box!
customer_reviews.author: KMBmommy

customer_reviews.title: Great Fire Retardant Box
customer_reviews.text: This box was exactly what I needed. It has enough room for all my important documents and other valuables. It's easy to lock and unlock and just the right size for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lane King

customer_reviews.title: Fits papers without folding
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a different size on accident and it didn't even fit a normal sheet of paper without folding. I returned it and go this one. It has plenty of room for a normal 8x11 paper with lots of space on the sides.The lock is smooth, comes with 2 keys and the handle is convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Marrakenzai

customer_reviews.title: sturdy good box for the money.
customer_reviews.text: well built sturdy box with a key lock. Nothing fancy metal box large enough for 11x8.5 papers. If you need to, you can drill through the bottom and screw it on to a surface to prevent removal. The metal is thin enough for that. it's a good box for the money.
customer_reviews.author: quick23

customer_reviews.title: Shoddily crafted and don't think there is very little that is fire-retardant about it.
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to believe that this is going to retard any fire at all as it is really shoddily made. The seams on the outside are not fastened shut and were pried up in places. The edges on the inside don't even meet. One of the two keys included was broken. It will hold articles but I have no doubt that they would not withstand a fire.
customer_reviews.author: C. Elsasser

customer_reviews.title: The box is of good build quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this security case to charge RC car batteries (to prevent fire in the event of a battery malfunctioning while charging). The box is of good build quality. It is decently heavy and has structure. Comes with a set of keys and envelopes to track sensitive documents (should you use the box for its intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... purchasing this product I thought it would be the perfect place to protect some of my more important documents
customer_reviews.text: When purchasing this product I thought it would be the perfect place to protect some of my more important documents. Unfortunately, when it arrived the product was defective. The top lid was not attached to the rest of the box and therefore it could not be shut or locked. The product was therefore unusable in its arrival state. All in all, very unfortunate experience since I am out $30 with no place to store my documents.
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: What gap?
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what other people are talking about when they say there is a gap that makes this box easy to break into. Mine does not have this gap and seems as sturdy as I would have hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It unlocked flawlessly several times (I always try things a lot at first to make sure the performance is good or bad from the getgo). Super sturdy. Happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Zender

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice size for papers
customer_reviews.text: I had a house fire when I was a child, so I don't mess around with important stuff NOT being fireproof. This is a nice size for papers, albeit a bit on the small side. I'm happy with it and will probably purchase a few more in time for photos and such.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Hold Enough but no Lid Latch
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice box, and holds what I need it to hold, but I'll agree with some other reviews that it is not completely fire or waterproof. My main problem with it though, is that unless it is locked, the lid doesn't latch, which makes it difficult to carry if not locked.
customer_reviews.author: SMC

customer_reviews.title: Nice size..
customer_reviews.text: Overall it is nice, but I wish it had a latch also, so that if you didn't want to lock it with a key, it would still close..it fits my needs otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Carol J. O'Neil

customer_reviews.title: Best deal in a secure lockbox
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small fire-resistant box for my passport and valuable papers and this was a great deal. I'm confident that it will protect my goods and last a long time, unlike the folder it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Will H

customer_reviews.title: Rusted
customer_reviews.text: There was rust bottom and side part of it. I am going to keep it only because I don't want to go through trouble to send it back. I cannot believe Amazon sent this without quality check. I wouldn't recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Cakester

customer_reviews.title: We use it in the refrigerator.....
customer_reviews.text: We use it to lock chocolate and cheese. My wife is thin, I am heavy, she has self control, I have none. When she hides the key I have discipline and self control.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a good lock box, this is a good one for the price. I have had no issues with it. I use it for my coin and money bill collection. I use another one for legal paperwork. I haven't tried to take a pry bar to the box and test its durability or heavy dutiness so I am not sure how strong the parts are but I imagine they would put up a decent fight.
customer_reviews.author: Fullness of Time

customer_reviews.title: LiPo storage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for R/C LiPo battery storage. Really solid feel to it. I think they call this double-metal construction? Probably not explosion proof, but it wasn't advertized for that purpose. Although, just by coincidence, those fire retardant LiPo bags sold elsewhere fit snugly front-to-back so there is room for three (possibly four) of those side-by-side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for storing paper and documents!
customer_reviews.text: Nice large size for keeping things locked up. Not a super-secure lock but keeps anyone from just nosing through stuff. I like it because it holds files and papers flat.
customer_reviews.author: Chapwoman

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The lock could easily be pried open. I bought for fire protection which it seems to be well insulated. It is a sturdy box and The right size for legal papers.
customer_reviews.author: M J Coppock

customer_reviews.title: The photo shows files- so i thought my letter file ...
customer_reviews.text: The photo shows files- so i thought my letter file folders would fit. The box is smaller- and a darker (less attractive color) than the pic. I kept it because it's too heavy to deal with returning. So I've found another use for it.
customer_reviews.author: Allie G

customer_reviews.title: It seems fireproof
customer_reviews.text: Well in all fairness there is nothing wrong with the construction of the box. I bought one to keep all my documents safe etc. But i travel often and keep all my documents in a folder. However i could not find a single folder that could fit into the box as it is too small. Now i have to remove single plastic sheets from the folder to keep them safe in the box. Which means i am left attaching these plastic sheets every time i have to travel. I weould definitely understand the dimensions before oredering one.
customer_reviews.author: Sarthak

customer_reviews.title: Bought to keep my diploma and important papers safe. ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought to keep my diploma and important papers safe. Fits my diploma perfectly and has tons of extra room. The keys came in a smaller package and everything worked perfectly. I anticipate this box serving it's purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: Grey

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for important documents.
customer_reviews.text: Great storage location for documents and necessary information to be used by survivors to settle the affairs of a relative or parent.
customer_reviews.author: Chris E

customer_reviews.title: just what i needed
customer_reviews.text: was looking for a smallish fire resistant box to keep important docs in and this is perfect. it's more spacious than expected which is great and you can't beat the price. also nice it came with two keys.
customer_reviews.author: ashley olinger

customer_reviews.title: It’s the right size for what I wanted and it ...
customer_reviews.text: It’s the right size for what I wanted and it works but it isn’t the highest quality lock box. The lid closes a little uneven and the locking mechanism fell apart after a few months. I had to screw it back together with a screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Locks easily and securely
customer_reviews.text: The steel box is well made, locks easily and securely and fits nicely inside my nightstand drawer. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Marie Benson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, wonderful size
customer_reviews.text: I honestly can't vouch for the fire resistance, but this is just like the one they sell at Office Depot and it's a fraction of the price! I can stick my certificates in it without having to fold them.
customer_reviews.author: EJP

customer_reviews.title: Best value in price range
customer_reviews.text: -Big enough for folders and forms -Heavy gauge metal seems sturdy -handles on each side for carrying -no latch for closing other than lock -best value overall for the price
customer_reviews.author: MJC

customer_reviews.title: RECOMMENDED: Simple and Strong
customer_reviews.text: I use this to store my RC Lithium Polymer batteries. Its just a well-made steel box Simple and strong
customer_reviews.author: AJ Addy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty large gap between the lid and bottom of box ...
customer_reviews.text: Not waterproof; however, I did not read the description carefully enough and it does not claim to be. Pretty large gap between the lid and bottom of box even when it's locked. Doesn't seem reliable. Also, arrived a day late.
customer_reviews.author: Erin McDermott

customer_reviews.title: Amazon advertises NEW but sends you USED!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived beat up and USED when I ordered a new one. Come on Amazon. Wake up!!! It's the perfect size but know this! If someone wants to steal your stuff this won't stop them. This is only a way to hopefully keep your docs safe in a short fire.
customer_reviews.author: John J

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs one of these for important papers
customer_reviews.text: Have this to my granddaughter when she turned 16. She is now us old enough to keep social security card, birth certificate, ins papers and other valuables safe from fire, flood etc.
customer_reviews.author: jazmine canfield

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT SIZE - SEEMS STURDY
customer_reviews.text: This item has two handles on either side of the box, which I think is a good idea, in case I ever pack it with gold boullion or something! In the meantime, it is handy to be able to grab a handle and hoist it up onto a shelf. The walls of the box seem thick, and it appears that I will be able to store quite a bit inside it. I also purchased a fireproof bag into which I placed my important documents, and then I put the fireproof bag into the box. My mind is at ease, knowing that I won't lose important documents in the case of a fire.
customer_reviews.author: Silver_Rose

customer_reviews.title: Better than Expected
customer_reviews.text: This box exceeds my expectations. It is very heavy-duty and has insulated walls to resist fire. For the price, I would have expected just a simple metal box. However, for this quality, I would have expected to pay more. I am using this not to keep fire out, but instead to keep fire in! I am using this to store very dangerous LiPo batteries while charging, as they can produce violent uncontrollable fires when defective.
customer_reviews.author: X_HOBBES

customer_reviews.title: Problem with specs
customer_reviews.text: The item is OK, but there was a big problem with the specs on Amazon. It said "fire retardant to 1550 F," the highest rated item we could find for a reasonable price, which was why we bought it. When it arrived, the manufacturer's sleeve said "Fire retardant to 750 F" We told customer service, and they said the manufacturer would send us another. They did but it was also retardant to 750. We decided to keep it, and customer service generously offered a discount of 50%. We were very pleased with Amazon's reps, who were courteous and helpful. But the manufacturer needs to get its act together, and at the very least change the specs on the offering page.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Jonas

customer_reviews.title: Useless - does not hold a letter sized 'important document'.
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered so I could safely store my important documents in a fire retardant box - it isn't wide enough to hold a letter sized document. How utterly bizarre. Great quality, what a shame about the size restriction.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro B.

customer_reviews.title: Not anti theft- maybe anti fire
customer_reviews.text: The lock is absolute trash. I could pick it in a couple of minutes. That said, I do think it will protect things from fire. I have some vital documents in it. Don't get this if you are concerned with theft.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Hermes

customer_reviews.title: Very well-made fire retardant lock box
customer_reviews.text: Roomier than I expected, made with high-quality materials and is very sturdy and well-made. I bought it for my most important documents to protect them from fire or other damage. Very good quality for a very good price
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Glass

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for important documents.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lock box. Fits in my drawer and holds everything I need it to. The key/lock is super smooth and easy to use and the box itself is thick and heavy. It is a great size for documents and other important small items. I would highly recommend this brand and would buy again. I got it from the amazon warehouse but I can't find anything wrong with it so I don't know why it was sold as a second quality item.
customer_reviews.author: Mama L

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for securing prescription meds
customer_reviews.text: My Mom just moved into assisted living, but we still manage her meds. This is perfect for storing the meds and keeping them safe (and preventing theft). It easily fits in a dresser drawer and is secure, but lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: alice

customer_reviews.title: Good Lockbox
customer_reviews.text: This works quite well, I need to keep several medications locked up and this sturdy box does the trick, not real fancy, but practical and easy to use. The lock mechanism is sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: got the damaged one.
customer_reviews.text: It is the second one I purchased, got a little damaged, why can not warp the box more nicely sine so many customer complained that got the damaged box.
customer_reviews.author: kitty

product_meta.title: MMF Industries Jumbo Fire-Retardant Steel Security Chest with Key Lock (14-3/8"W x 4-1/8"H x 11"D), Sand (221615103)
product_meta.description: Style:Sand and Jumbo Size| Size:14.38 x 11 x 4.13 InchesThe MMF Industries Jumbo Fire-Retardant Steel Security Chest with Key Lock (221615103) is constructed of durable steel and engineered with double-insulated walls to protect contents from fire damage. It is lab tested at 750 degrees Fahrenheit for 15 minutes with paper media enclosed. The contents were charred, but legible. The chest holds file folders and 9-by-12-inch documents to lay flat in bottom. The chest includes a lock with two keys and two carrying handles for convenience. The sand-colored chest's external dimensions are 14-3/8"W x 11"D x 4-1/8"H (includes handles and lock). Internal dimensions are 12-3/16"W x 10-3/16"D x 3-1/2"H. This item does not come with a warranty card.
feature_bullets: Fire-retardant steel security box with key lock protects valuables from fire
Durable steel construction with double-insulated walls
Holds 9-by-12-inch documents to lay flat in bottom; includes lock with two keys
External dimensions: 14-3/8"W x 11"D x 4-1/8"H (includes handles and locks; Internal dimensions: 12-3/16"W x 10-3/16"D x 3-1/2"H

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,537 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
